Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Jug
Description: Small vase in the shape of a jug with a globular body extending into a long vertical neck and ending in a beaded lip. A high vertical handle joins the top of the neck to the shoulder. The small base is annular. The exterior surface is red slipped. A geometrical design is painted in black: a horizontal line at the base of the neck, three series of three parallel vertical lines joining the base of the neck to the bottom of the vase, and two series of three small horizontal lines on the uppermost and lowermost sections of the handle.
